name: metric-find-clusters
author: Washington University School of Medicin
description:
Filter clusters by surface area.

Outputs a metric with nonzero integers for all vertices within a large enough cluster, and zeros elsewhere.  The integers denote cluster membership (by default, first cluster found will use value 1, second cluster 2, etc).  Cluster values are not reused across maps of the output, but instead keep counting up.  By default, values greater than <value-threshold> are considered to be in a cluster, use -less-than to test for values less than the threshold.  To apply this as a mask to the data, or to do more complicated thresholding, see -metric-math.

inputs.name: minimum_area
inputs.description: threshold for cluster area, in mm^2

inputs.name: opt_less_than
inputs.description: find values less than <value-threshold>, rather than greater

inputs.name: opt_roi_roi_metric
inputs.description: select a region of interest: the roi, as a metric

inputs.name: opt_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

inputs.name: opt_column_column
inputs.description: select a single column: the column number or name

inputs.name: opt_size_ratio_ratio
inputs.description: ignore clusters smaller than a given fraction of the largest cluster in map: fraction of the largest cluster's area

inputs.name: opt_distance_distance
inputs.description: ignore clusters further than a given distance from the largest cluster: how far from the largest cluster a cluster can be, edge to edge, in mm

inputs.name: opt_start_startval
inputs.description: start labeling clusters from a value other than 1: the value to give the first cluster found
